com.pump.animation.writing

Class WritingShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.animation.writing.WritingShape

  • public class WritingShape
extends java.lang.Object
    A series of related WritingStroke objects to paint sequentially.

    This is used to give the impression of painting strokes over time.

    • Field Detail

      • BOUNDS_KEY

        public static final ObservableProperties.Key<java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D> BOUNDS_KEY
        The key that relates to the bounds of this shape. Note these are not the literal bounds; this is the expected frame. Strokes do not need to fill these bounds, and they can liberally step outside of these bounds for occasional flourishes.

      • strokes

        public final ObservableList<WritingStroke> strokes
        The WritingStrokes in this shape.

      • properties

        protected final ObservableProperties properties
        The properties this shape manages. Currently this only manages the BOUNDS_KEY.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset this WritingShape to have no strokes and a unit rectangle as bounds.

      • assign

        public void assign(java.lang.String s)
        Invoke reset() and reformat this shape from the string provided.
        Parameters:
        s - previous output from WritingShape.toString()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Serialize this shape as a String. This mimics the standard shape output (m, l, q, c, z), except it also includes the instruction "b" (4 arguments for the bounds), and "w" (1 argument for the pause beat). The "w" instruction happens to separate each unique WritingStroke.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener pcl)
        Add a PropertyChangeListener that will be notified when the bounds of this WritingShape change.
        Parameters:
        pcl - a new listener to receive notifications when the bounds change.

      • removePropertyChangeListener

        public void removePropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener pcl)
        Remove a PropertyChangeListener.
        Parameters:
        pcl - the listener to remove.

      • getStrokes

        public ObservableList<WritingStroke> getStrokes()
        Return the strokes in this shape.
        Returns:
        a list of al the strokes in this shape.

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D r)
        Assign the bounds of this shape.

        Note these are not the literal bounds; this is the expected frame. Strokes do not need to fill these bounds, and they can liberally step outside of these bounds for occasional flourishes.

        Parameters:
        r - the new bounds for this shape.

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds()
        Return the bounds of this shape.

        Note these are not the literal bounds; this is the expected frame. Strokes do not need to fill these bounds, and they can liberally step outside of these bounds for occasional flourishes.

        Returns:
        the bounds of this shape.

      • getDuration

        public float getDuration(float beatsPerSecond,
                         float pixelsPerSecond)
        Return the duration (in seconds) of this stroke at the given speeds.
        Parameters:
        beatsPerSecond - the number of beats per second.
        pixelsPerSecond - the number of pixels per second.
        Returns:
        the duration (in seconds) of this stroke.

      • getPixels

        public float getPixels()

      • paint

        public boolean paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                     java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D bounds,
                     float time,
                     float beatsPerSecond,
                     float pixelsPerSecond)
        Paint this shape, or a portion of this shape.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics to paint to.
        bounds - the bounds of this shape to draw to. The Graphics2D will be transformed so every stroke will fit in this argument as if it were WritingShape.getBounds().
        time - the time (in seconds), where t=0 is the beginning of rendering this shape.
        beatsPerSecond - the number of beats per second.
        pixelsPerSecond - the number of pixels per second.
        Returns:
        whether the shape is completely rendered. This should be equivalent to (t < getDuration( beatsPerSecond, pixelsPerSecond) .
